title: Bookmark Manager module
text: Adding Bookmark Manager module DaVinci application usually requires appending single extra line module_list parameter dv.manager::run_app: look like context: Notice call mod_bookman require module ID. make sense include inside application default ID enough. module signature still offers possibility changing default ID: second parameter module, bookmark_dir, overrides auto-detection server bookmark folder.
code: "Bookmarks" = dv.bookman::mod_bookman() app <- function() {   dataset <- ...    module_list <- list(     "Tab 1" = mod_1(module_id = "mod1"), ...,     "Bookmarks" = dv.bookman::mod_bookman()   )    dv.manager::run_app(     data = list("DS" = dataset),     module_list = module_list,     filter_data = "adsl"   ) } mod_bookman <- function(module_id = "_bookman", bookmark_dir = NULL)

title: Bookmark Manager module
text: module collects information standard server bookmark files input.rds values.rds writes index featured bookmarks descriptions root bookmark folder, file bookmark_info.rds. name location file part documented interface module relevant aspects life cycle application, backups. contents file considered unspecified purposes manual, except say remain backwards compatible. bookmark_info.rds file created earlier version Bookmark Manager module work expected newer versions converse guaranteed.

title: dv.bookman
text: Shiny server-side bookmark manager DaVinci. Bookmark Manager module provides centralized view server bookmarks given DaVinci app.
